French: Je sais que tom sera objectif.

English: I know tom will be objective.
I doubt you'll be able to do that.
French: Je doute que vous {{c::puissiez}} le faire.
Je me suis séché le visage.
Je sais que tom sera favorable.
Je sais que tom sera solidaire.

English: She was advised by him not to go.
French: Il lui {{c::conseilla}} de ne pas partir.

English: I dream about you every night.
French: Je rêve de vous toutes les {{c::nuits}}.
Il sera de retour à 4 heures.

English: I knew every one of those guys.
I work on the other side of town.
French: Je travaille de {{c::l'autre}} côté de la ville.

English: The time for talking is over.
French: Le temps de la {{c::discussion}} est passé.

English: He took part in the race.
Do you want me to leave you alone?
I thought you wanted to wait.

French: Je me suis cogné le genou.
Je désire qu'elle cesse de fumer.
Il a cédé à la tentation.

English: What i want is a divorce.
French: Ce que je veux, c'est le {{c::divorce}}.
Il ne cesse jamais de réfléchir.

English: Do you have a christmas tree?

French: Je me suis mordu la langue.

English: I've already explained that to tom.

French: Es-tu à la hauteur de la tâche ?

English: A drunk man's words are a {{c::sober}} man's thoughts.

French: Il ne met jamais de cravate.

English: I'm going to go on a {{c::picnic}} tomorrow.
French: Demain, je vais à un pique-nique.

English: I'm going to go on a picnic tomorrow.
I thought that you were smart.

French: Il est temps de faire le point.
Je pense que tom voit l'idée.
Nous ne {{c::sommes}} pas à la maison.

English: I thought you could help me.
I don't want that kind of responsibility.
French: Je ne veux pas ce genre de {{c::responsabilité}}.
